WorkItem.ClosedComment: This issue has been open for 30+ days without a response. If this is still an issue, please resubmit against the current version and upload any necessary files
WorkItem.Description:
So i get this whenever I try to run Rawr. I tried backtracking to multiple different older versions resulting in the same error.
I went into windows updates and ran the updates that were needed thinking it would fix the problem but no luck.
If anyone has suggestions or advice please let me know
 
This is the error:
--------------------------------------------------
Configuration system failed to initialize 
 
 
 
   at System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.PrepareConfigSystem()
 
   at System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.RefreshSection(String sectionName)
 
   at System.Configuration.ClientSettingsStore.ReadSettings(String sectionName, Boolean isUserScoped)
 
   at System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.GetPropertyValues(SettingsContext context, SettingsPropertyCollection properties)
 
   at System.Configuration.SettingsBase.GetPropertiesFromProvider(SettingsProvider provider)
 
   at System.Configuration.SettingsBase.GetPropertyValueByName(String propertyName)
 
   at System.Configuration.SettingsBase.get_Item(String propertyName)
 
   at System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.GetPropertyValue(String propertyName)
 
   at System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.get_Item(String propertyName)
 
   at Rawr.Properties.Recent.get_RecentModel()
 
   at Rawr.FormMain..ctor()
 
   at Rawr.Program.Main()

Comments.Message: That means that Rawr doesn't have permissions to read its own files. Try Run as Administrator.
Thanks for the response Astylian! but.. I have already tried that, same error.
Is the Rawr folder located in a place where you have full permissions? Try running it from your "My Documents" folder and see if that helps.
Ive tried extracting a copy to Documents and C drive with no luck :( . I don't think that the privilege setting is the problem because I am the only user on this computer and am the administrator.
Make sure the Rawr.exe.config file is there. Also, look in your Documents/Local Settings (show hidden folders) and any sub folders for any Rawr related folders, and delete those.

Ok, I did that and could not find any hidden folders. I downloaded Rawr b16.1 and tryed the .exe but with this version it goes to the rawr loading image then the loading image just disappears and nothing happens. I dont know if that is helpful to what might be going on with the error i get with the newest version.

Ive attached an image of the Rawr v2.2.13 folder and the data folder. The Rawr v2.2.13 folder is in Documents folder
Rawr... b16.1? That's like... Years old. Literally. There's no reason to use anything but the most recent version, unless we specifically say so on the main/download page.
Found a rawr folder in AppData and deleted it. It wasnt that Im still getting the same error.
